intro: Dirichletia duemmeri, commonly known as the Duemmer's dirichletia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
